p.s: This wikiHow teaches you how to see the upload speed and download speed of your Internet connection , as well as the speed of the connection between your computer and your router .
Knowing your Internet speed can help you figure out what you can do with your internet connection .

item.s: Go to the Google Speed Test page .

Open a Google search page by going to
https://www.google.com
in a web browser or open the Google app on your device and type into the search field .
This will bring up an " Internet speed test " window at the top of the Google search results .
You can use this method on a computer , phone , or tablet .
This method will use Google 's built-in internet speed testing tool .

There are other alternatives you could use , such as
Fast.com
, if you prefer an alternative .
Click .
It 's a blue button in the bottom-right corner of the " Internet speed test " panel .
Wait for the speed test to complete .
Google will measure your Internet connection 's upload speed , download speed , and latency .
Review the test results .

In addition to telling you whether your Internet qualifies as " fast " or " slow " , Google measures three aspects of your Internet 's speed :
Mbps download
- The number of megabits per second your connection is allowing you to download .

list.item:
Mbps upload
- The number of megabits per second your connection is uploading .

Latency
-
The number of milliseconds it takes for your Internet connection to respond to a command ( e. g. , a search query or a page loading ) .

item.s: Make sure your computer is connected to your router .

To check your Internet speed from your computer 's settings , you must connect your computer to your router
via Ethernet cable
.
Open Start .
This icon is in the bottom-left corner of the screen .
Click .
It 's in the bottom-left corner of the Start window .
Click Network & Internet .
It 's in the top row of settings on the Settings page .
Click .
This tab is on the left side of the window .
Doing so will open your Ethernet settings .
Click .
It 's in the upper-right side of the window .
Double-click the Ethernet connection .
You 'll see this monitor-shaped icon at the top of the Network Connections window .
Review the " Speed " value .
It 's near the bottom of the " Connections " section of information on the Ethernet Status window .
The number here ( e. g. , " 90.0 Mbps " ) represents the speed of the connection between your computer and the router .

list.item:
Make sure your computer is connected to your router .
To check your Internet speed from your computer 's settings , you must connect your computer to your router
via Ethernet cable
.

item.s: Open Spotlight .
It 's in the top-right corner of your Mac 's screen .
Type " network utility " into Spotlight , then press .
Doing so will open the Network Utility app .
Click the tab .
It 's on the far-left side of the top of the Network Utility window .
Select your Ethernet connection .
Click the box below the " Select a network interface for information " heading , then click your Ethernet connection 's name .

list.item:
Look at the number next to " Link Speed " .
You 'll see something like " 100 Mbit/s " here , which would mean the speed of the connection between your computer and your router is 100 megabits of data per second .

Switch to a wired connection .
If your wireless connection is experiencing significant lag , then you may need to connect to a wired connection ( usually through Ethernet ) in order to boost your Internet performance speed .

item.s: Restart your Wi-Fi access point .
Sometimes , routers or other devices that can access wi-fi may need to be restarted in order to fix any performance issues caused by a glitch or broken connection .
Connect to another network .
In order to check if the problem is a network or just your device , connect to another network you have access to and check that network 's Internet speed .
Run a malware scan on your device .
In some instances , a slow Internet speed could mean your device is being slowed down by malware in its system .
To remedy this , install an antivirus program with a malware scanner included in it .

list.item:
Your Internet 's true connection speed is often much lower than your router 's maximum speed .
Using Ethernet allows you to take advantage of your router 's speed .

item.s: Benchmarks for common features include : 5 Megabits per second for HD streaming and 90 kilobits per second for VOiP calling

list.item: Your Internet speed will never exceed either your router 's maximum speed or your Internet plan 's maximum speed -- whichever speed is lower .
